medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral conjunctival scarring and irritation, cough, oral lesions, and chest rash.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first patient presented with symptoms of conjunctival scarring and irritation for 5 months, which initially improved with topical treatment but did not resolve. Concurrently, cough, hoarseness, and pulmonary congestion developed, followed by oral blistering. The second patient, diagnosed with CLL, experienced ocular irritation and bilateral extensive symblephara after one month, progressing with oral and skin lesions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: First patient had a diagnosis of poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma of the lung. Second patient had a recent diagnosis of B-cell chronic lymphocytic leukemia.
medical_history.social_history: First patient had a 20-pack/year smoking history but quit 12 years prior.
